definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: The negative in a set of color separations that represents photographically the portions of the copy that will print as black.
sentences.chinese: 中義一組分色片中將來是印黑色部份的那一張陰片。

sentences.english: Viewers watched the film using glasses with different-coloured filters in their lenses.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆在看電影時要佩戴有分色濾光片的眼鏡。

sentences.english: Different colors in book cover were adopted for a good presentation and easy identification.
sentences.chinese: 爲了美觀和便於識別，《四庫全書》採用分色裝潢。

sentences.english: In the interest of beauty and convenience for recognition, every category of the encyclopedia was decorated in one single color.
sentences.chinese: 爲了美觀和便於識別，《四庫全書》採用分色裝潢。

sentences.english: Digital prepress in general contains four color and special color separation techniques.
sentences.chinese: 數字印前處理通常包括四色和專色分色兩種技術。

sentences.english: Dichroic bevels are excellent for creating glass art.
sentences.chinese: 分色斜面是創造優良的玻璃藝術。

sentences.english: The paper presents a new algorithm to improve color separation accuracy of fabric graphics.
sentences.chinese: 本文設計了一個提高織物圖案分色精度的新算法。

sentences.english: See examples of dichroic bevels in this free video.
sentences.chinese: 參見本免費視頻分色斜面的例子。

sentences.english: Insulation wire core color separation, installation convenience for installation.
sentences.chinese: 絕緣線芯分色，爲敷設安裝提供方便。

definition: color printing using several overlaid images
painted ornament/livery (on airline or company vehicle)
line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
